items.title: OpenAI employee quits, calls AI race a ‘risky gamble’
items.author: Steven Adler
items.summary:
- Steven Adler, an AI researcher and safety officer at OpenAI, resigned due to concerns about the rapid pace of AI development.
- He worked at OpenAI since March 2022, eight months before the launch of ChatGPT, and is worried about artificial general intelligence (AGI) potentially exceeding human intelligence.
- Adler warned that the global race to achieve AGI is a 'very risky gamble' and that the urgency could compromise vital safety measures.
- He emphasized the difficulties in ensuring AI systems' goals align with human values, highlighting the challenges of AI alignment.
- Despite assurances from OpenAI CEO Sam Altman that AGI should benefit humanity, Adler hopes AI labs will adopt stronger safety regulations.
- He pointed out the increasing competition with the launch of DeepSeek by a Chinese startup and stressed the need for collaboration to mitigate AI risks.

items.title: Why Indian EV players are charging into the SEA opportunity
items.summary:
- Indian electric vehicle (EV) manufacturers are expanding into Southeast Asia (SEA).
- This shift is driven by increasing demand for EVs in the region and supportive government policies.
- Companies are exploring partnerships and investments to capitalize on opportunities in markets like Indonesia and Thailand.

items.title: Google offers voluntary exits for Android, Pixel teams
items.summary:
- Google has announced voluntary exit options for employees in its Android and Pixel teams.
- The decision comes amid organizational restructuring within the company.
- Voluntary exit packages are being offered to help streamline operations.

items.title: OpenAI said to raise funding round with $340b valuation
items.summary:
- OpenAI is negotiating a funding round that could value the company at up to $340 billion.
- The specific investors or size of the investment has not been disclosed.
- OpenAI has garnered significant investor interest due to rapid advancements in AI technologies.

items.title: Data center operator DataBank raises $850m equity investment
items.summary:
- DataBank secures $250 million from private equity firm TJC and $600 million from secondary share offering.
- Investment driven by increasing demand for high-performance computing due to AI advancements.
- DataBank operates over 65 data centers in 27 markets and has raised $5 billion in capital in the past 18 months.
- The industry is anticipated to see capital expenditures exceed $250 billion in the next five years according to a McKinsey report.

items.title: Swiggy’s company secretary resigns
items.summary:
- Swiggy's company secretary has resigned.
- The resignation indicates potential changes in corporate governance.
- Further details on the reason for the resignation have not been disclosed.

items.title: Microsoft cloud growth slows amid challenges
items.summary:
- Microsoft anticipates slow growth in Azure cloud-computing business for the current quarter, with revenue expected to increase by up to 32%.
- Sluggish growth attributed to limited data center capacity, despite a 157% increase in Azure AI services.
- The company plans to invest US$80 billion in building AI data centers this fiscal year.
- Challenges include profitability issues and competition, even with strong demand and infrastructure investments.

items.title: LinkedIn’s Premium revenue hits $2b, faces growth challenge
items.summary:
[LinkedIn’s Premium revenue reaches $2 billion]
[The platform faces challenges in maintaining growth]
[Further insights on revenue sources and competitive pressures available in the full article]

items.title: Turkey to invest $2b in high-tech sectors by 2025: minister
items.author: Mehmet Fatih Kacir
items.summary:
- Turkey plans to invest $2 billion in high-tech sectors by 2025, focusing on biotechnology, industrial robotics, and hyperscale data centers.
- The investment package announced by Industry and Technology Minister Mehmet Fatih Kacir will begin in February.
- Key milestones in 2024 include the launch of the first indigenous communication satellite, Turksat 6A, and progress in its lunar program.
- Turkey is becoming a significant player in electric vehicle (EV) and battery technologies, with $7 billion attracted in investments over the last 22 years.
- Ongoing negotiations with BYD and Chery aim to establish EV production and R&D in Turkey.
- Government efforts also include investments in southeastern Turkey and Syria to enhance economic growth by 2028.

items.title: Egypt’s Simplex raises $13m to build factory in Saudi Arabia
items.summary:
- Simplex has raised US$13 million for a factory in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.
- The facility will span 20,000 square meters and is set to open in Q1 2026.
- This initiative aligns with Saudi Arabia's Vision 2030 to localize industries and diversify the economy.
- Simplex aims to meet rising demand for CNC machines and expand its exports to 21 countries.

items.title: Tesla sees $600m bitcoin surge after new digital assets rule
items.summary:
- Tesla's investment in Bitcoin has surged in value by approximately $600 million.
- This increase follows the implementation of new regulations regarding digital assets.
- The regulatory changes are expected to impact the cryptocurrency market positively and may lead to increased institutional investment.

items.title: Saudi stock market shines among top regional performers
items.summary:
- Saudi Arabia’s stock market was among the top performers in the Arab region in December 2024.
- The Tadawul All Share Index (TASI) increased by 3.39%, closing at 12,037 points, with an average daily trading value of SAR 5.2 billion (US$1.3 billion).
- Regional growth leaders included the Dubai Financial Market (6.42%), Palestine (4.58%), and Iraq (4.14%).
- The Arab Monetary Fund composite index for Arab financial markets rose by 1.03%, influenced by improved investor sentiment and monetary easing.
- Market capitalization across Arab exchanges increased by 2.96% to US$4.4 trillion, with significant contributions from Tadawul.
- Central banks in Saudi Arabia, the UAE, Qatar, and Bahrain reduced interest rates, enhancing investor confidence and market liquidity.

items.title: Indian beauty startup co-founder resigns amid financial woes
items.summary:
- Ashish Mishra, co-founder and chief business officer of Clensta, resigned due to cash flow issues and funding difficulties.
- His resignation was effective October 2024; he cited differences in company direction.
- He mentioned ongoing discussions with investors regarding unpaid salaries in an email to staff.
- Mishra plans to start a new venture in the beauty and personal care sector with other investors.

items.title: Italy blocks DeepSeek over data concerns
items.summary:
- Italy’s data protection authority, Garante, blocked access to the Chinese AI app DeepSeek due to insufficient information on personal data handling.
- The decision took effect on January 30, 2025, leading to its removal from Apple and Google stores in Italy.
- An investigation has been launched into the app after deemed insufficient responses from DeepSeek’s associated companies regarding data collection and storage.

items.title: Meta’s Reality Labs reports nearly $5b loss in Q4
items.summary:
- Meta's Reality Labs reported an operating loss of US$4.97 billion in Q4 2024.
- Generated US$1.1 billion in revenue, slightly above analysts' expectations of a US$5.4 billion loss.
- Accumulated over US$60 billion in operating losses since 2020, raising concerns about Meta's commitment to the metaverse.
- Plans to invest US$60-65 billion in capital expenditures in 2025.

items.title: US lawmakers push for Nvidia chip export curbs over DeepSeek
items.author: John Moolenaar, Raja Krishnamoorthi
items.summary:
- Two US lawmakers, Rep. John Moolenaar and Rep. Raja Krishnamoorthi, have requested new restrictions on Nvidia’s advanced AI chip exports due to concerns over its use by Chinese company DeepSeek.
- The request was made in a letter sent to National Security Advisor Michael Waltz on January 29, focusing on the Nvidia H20 chip.
- This chip is not currently covered by existing US export controls and is utilized by DeepSeek for its latest AI models.
- Lawmakers expressed concerns that DeepSeek’s new AI assistant could pose risks regarding cyberattacks or bioweapons development.
- Nvidia stated its products comply with current regulations and is willing to engage with officials on AI policy; DeepSeek and the White House have yet to comment.

items.title: Saudi fintech firm Lendo secures $690m led by JPMorgan
items.summary:
- Lendo, a Saudi-based debt crowdfunding platform, secures SAR 2.6 billion (US$690 million) warehouse facility led by JPMorgan.
- Financing aims to enhance lending capacity for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in Saudi Arabia.
- Initiative aligns with Saudi Vision 2030 goal to increase SME lending from 4% in 2018 to 20% by 2030.

items.title: Flipkart introduces credit card bill payment feature
items.summary:
- Flipkart has launched a credit card bill payment feature on its platform, Flipkart Pay.
- The service operates through the Bharat Bill Payment Service (BBPS) and does not charge a convenience fee.
- This feature expands Flipkart’s Recharges and Bill Payments services initiated in 2023 under the Bharat Connect initiative.
- The platform currently supports utility payments for electricity, water, broadband, and mobile services across nine categories.

items.title: Israeli cybersecurity firm Semperis hits $100m in ARR
items.author: Mickey Bresman, Guy Teverovsky, Matan Liberman
items.summary:
- Semperis has surpassed US$100 million in annual recurring revenue (ARR) as of January 30.
- The company was founded in 2013 and is based in Hoboken, New Jersey.
- Semperis has around 500 employees globally, with approximately 150 in Tel Aviv.
- The firm specializes in identity security solutions for hybrid Active Directory environments, predominantly serving Fortune 500 companies.
- Their disaster recovery system focuses on mitigating and recovering from cyberattacks to restore operations.

items.title: Bukalapak leaps into edtech, but not without skeptics
items.summary:
- Bukalapak expands into the edtech sector, aiming to diversify its business model.
- The move has raised skepticism among industry experts regarding its feasibility and potential effectiveness.
- Analysts highlight competitive challenges in the edtech market that could impact Bukalapak's success.

items.title: DeepSeek faces global data security restrictions
items.summary:
- Companies and government agencies are limiting access to tools from Chinese AI startup DeepSeek due to data privacy concerns.
- The concerns arise from DeepSeek's data storage practices and compliance with Chinese regulations, as noted by cybersecurity firms Armis and Netskope.
- DeepSeek’s privacy policy indicates extensive user data collection (keystrokes, text, audio) and mentions that disputes will be governed by Chinese law.

items.title: Amazon cuts jobs in sustainability, communications units
items.summary:
- Amazon announced job cuts in its communications and sustainability divisions as part of a restructuring effort.
- The layoffs were communicated by executive Drew Herdener on January 29.
- Reasons cited for cuts include redundancies and roles with limited scope.
- Affected employees will receive financial support, benefits, and job-placement assistance.
- Some staff may be rehired for different roles or have their positions redistributed within the organization.

items.title: US investors to offer more than $20b for TikTok
items.author: Jesse Tinsley, David Baszucki, Nathan McCauley
items.summary:
- An American investor group led by Jesse Tinsley aims to acquire TikTok's US operations for over $20 billion.
- Notable investors include Roblox CEO David Baszucki and Anchorage Digital CEO Nathan McCauley.
- The bid surpasses another offer of $20 billion, indicating a competitive atmosphere in the market.
- Communication with TikTok's parent company, ByteDance, has not yet occurred, as they maintain that the TikTok US business is not for sale.
- Tinsley reported no direct feedback from ByteDance.

items.title: Rakuten drops IPO plan, shifts strategy in competitive market
items.author: Hiroshi Mikitani
items.summary:
- Rakuten Group Inc. will not proceed with the IPO of Rakuten Securities Holdings Inc. on the Tokyo Stock Exchange.
- Originally planned to stabilize finances after entering the competitive wireless market.
- IPO application was temporarily withdrawn in late 2023 but has now been abandoned.
- Focus will shift to collaboration with Mizuho Securities Co.
- Rakuten reported its first quarterly operating profit since 2020 in November 2024, attributed to reduced losses in its mobile segment.

items.title: Swiss hearing aid maker sees stock surge on AI device
items.summary:
- Swiss hearing aid manufacturer experiences a significant increase in stock value due to the announcement of a new AI-driven hearing aid device.
- The innovative product aims to enhance user experience by utilizing advanced AI technologies for sound processing.
- Market analysts predict strong sales growth and a positive impact on the company's financial performance following the launch.

items.title: IBM Q4 earnings surpass estimates, software revenue surges
items.summary:
[IBM reported its Q4 earnings, exceeding analysts' expectations.]
[Software revenue saw significant growth, contributing to overall financial performance.]
[Investors reacted positively, boosting share prices after the announcement.]

items.title: SoftBank said to invest $25b in OpenAI
items.summary:
- SoftBank Group Corp. is reportedly discussing a potential investment of up to $25 billion in OpenAI.
- If confirmed, this would make SoftBank the largest backer of OpenAI.
- The investment may range from $15 billion to $25 billion, in addition to a prior $15 billion commitment to Project Stargate.
- Previous investments have been noted, including a possible lead of $500 million for Skild AI and a $100 billion AI infrastructure deal with OpenAI and Oracle.

items.title: Apple supplier Qorvo shares fall 3.4%
items.summary:
- Shares of Qorvo fell by 3.4% in after-hours trading after an earnings forecast suggested limited sales growth to Apple.
- Qorvo's fiscal Q3 earnings report showed adjusted earnings per share at US$1.61, exceeding the forecast of US$1.20, with revenue at US$916 million against an expectation of US$902 million.
- Apple made up 46% of Qorvo's fiscal 2024 revenue, while Qorvo anticipates a revenue decline of US$150 million to US$200 million in its Android business for fiscal 2026, mainly due to declining sales in China.

items.title: Meta Q4 hits $48.4b revenue amid AI spending scrutiny
items.summary:
- Meta Platforms reported Q4 2024 revenue of US$48.4 billion, exceeding expectations.
- Q1 2025 forecasted revenue is between US$39.5 billion and US$41.8 billion, below analysts’ estimates.
- CEO Mark Zuckerberg emphasized the commitment to AI, advocating for open-source models as a standard.
- Meta plans up to US$65 billion in capital expenditures for AI in 2025, with significant expense increases anticipated.
- Despite strong ad revenue growth, investor concerns persist due to ongoing losses in Meta's Reality Labs.
- Zuckerberg mentioned potential adoption of innovations from DeepSeek’s AI advancements.

items.title: India’s auto platform CarTrade shares jump 18% on profit
items.summary:
- On Jan. 29, shares of CarTrade Technology increased by 18.65% to 1,624.20 rupees (US$18.76) on the BSE.
- This rise followed the company’s announcement of a return to profitability in Q3 FY25, reporting a net profit of 45.53 crore rupees (US$5.26 million).
- The company's stock has rebounded strongly, gaining over 54% in six months, after struggling post-IPO in 2021.
- CarTrade operates brands such as CarWale, BikeWale, and Shriram Automall, competing with platforms like CarDekho and CARS24.

items.title: Microsoft, Meta defend AI spending amid DeepSeek disruption
items.summary:
- Microsoft and Meta defend their ongoing AI investments despite challenges posed by the disruption from DeepSeek.
- Both companies report a commitment to their AI projects and overall technology growth strategy.
- The discussion sheds light on the ongoing competitive landscape in the AI sector and investment priorities.

items.title: Blockchain identity platform raises $20m, valued at $1.1b
items.summary:
- Humanity Protocol has raised US$20 million in funding led by Pantera Capital and Jump Crypto.
- The valuation of Humanity Protocol is now US$1.1 billion.
- The platform addresses online fraud by enabling users to verify blockchain-based identities through palm scans.
- Funds will be used to enhance integration with Web3 platforms and develop Proof of Humanity and Human ID systems.
- Previously, in May 2024, the company raised US$30 million led by Kingsway Capital.

items.title: Intel set to report Q4 earnings as shares drop
items.summary:
- Intel to report Q4 earnings on January 30, facing declining revenue and leadership changes.
- Shares have fallen 60% in the past year, with a market cap of about US$85 billion.
- Analysts expect a 10.4% revenue drop in Q4 to US$13.81 billion; datacenter revenue down over 15% for 11 consecutive quarters.
- Company contends with high manufacturing costs and competition from AMD and TSMC, as cloud operators shift focus to AI chips.
- Interim co-CEOs Michelle Johnston Holthaus and David Zinsner lead after the removal of CEO Pat Gelsinger.

items.title: UAE proptech startup Silkhaus secures seven-figure funding
items.summary:
- Silkhaus, a startup for short-term rentals, secured a seven-figure funding round led by Nuwa Capital and Oraseya Capital.
- Additional investors include Impulse International, Yuj Ventures, and Nordstar.
- The funding will help Silkhaus enter the Saudi Arabian market, where its booking platform is already operational, targeting key neighborhoods in Riyadh such as Al Sahafa, Al Nada, and Qurtuba.

items.title: Taiwan to hold emergency talks on Trump’s chip tariffs
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- The Taiwanese government is preparing for emergency discussions following Trump's announcement of proposed tariffs on imported semiconductors.
- Premier Cho Jung-tai emphasized the need for strategies to support Taiwan's semiconductor industry if tariffs are enacted.
- Trump's tariff proposal targets semiconductors among other imports, declared on Jan. 27 during a Republican conference.
- Taiwan's semiconductor industry is crucial for its economy, making up a significant portion of exports.
- Collaboration is deemed essential to maintain Taiwan’s technological edge, according to Cho.

items.title: Turkish mobile gaming startup raises $2.5b in debt, equity
items.summary:
- Istanbul-based mobile game developer Dream Games is negotiating to raise US$2.5 billion through debt and equity.
- The financing round, led by Goldman Sachs Group Inc., may value the company at nearly US$5 billion, doubling its valuation since 2022.
- Dream Games aims to secure about US$1.25 billion in debt from private credit lenders and an equal amount in equity.
- The funding will aid in buying out current external investors, including major venture capital firms.
- Founded in 2019, Dream Games is known for its title Royal Match, which became the highest revenue-generating smartphone game in 2023, surpassing Candy Crush.

items.title: Leap raises $65m series E to expand AI, global reach
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Leap, an edtech startup, raised US$65 million in series E funding led by Apis Partners’ funds.
- Existing investors include Owl Ventures, Jungle Ventures, and Peak XV Partners, totaling US$210 million raised since 2019.
- Leap operates through LeapScholar, LeapFinance, Yocket, and Geebee, providing services for students studying abroad.
- The company is expanding into the Middle East and Southeast Asia, collaborating with over 1,000 international universities.
- Funds will enhance product offerings and support AI-driven initiatives in test preparation and student assessments.
- Previous funding rounds include US$75 million in series D (2022) and US$55 million in series C (2021).

items.title: 20 largest exits in Singapore
Tenable to acquire Israeli cybersecurity startup for $150m
items.summary:
- Tenable, a Nasdaq-listed cybersecurity firm, plans to acquire Vulcan Cyber for approximately US$150 million.
- The acquisition is expected to be finalized in Q1 2025, pending customary closing conditions.
- Vulcan Cyber, founded in 2018, specializes in cybersecurity services and has raised US$55 million from various investors.

items.title: French fintech Formance raises $21m to expand operations
items.summary:
- French fintech startup Formance raised $21 million in a Series A funding round led by PayPal Ventures and Portage.
- Existing investors like Y Combinator, Hoxton Ventures, and Axeleo participated in the round.
- Formance provides financial operation solutions, including a programmable financial ledger and payment orchestration tools.
- The startup is developing a mass payout product to connect with Stripe, Adyen, and Mangopay.
- Currently serving 20 customers, US-based clients contribute 40% of Formance's revenue.
- Plans to open a New York office and expand workforce from 20 to 50 employees by the end of 2025, focusing on engineering and product development.

items.title: Tokyo Stock Exchange parent company to cut CEO pay
items.summary:
- The Japan Exchange Group (JPX) plans to cut CEO Yamaji Hiromi's pay.
- Decision follows insider trading allegations against a former employee.
- The former employee was indicted in December 2024 for sharing confidential information about a corporate takeover.
- Charges involve violations of the Financial Instruments and Exchange Act.
- Pay reduction aims to clarify the CEO’s management responsibilities amid the incident.

items.title: Israeli cloud security firm Oligo secures $50m series B
items.summary:
- Oligo Security has raised $50 million in a series B funding round.
- Total funding now amounts to $80 million over the past two years.
- The funding round was led by Greenfield Partners, with contributions from Red Dot Capital Partners, Strait Capital, and others.
- Oligo's platform targets security risks in cloud applications and helps monitor, detect, and prevent breaches.
- The company employs over 50 people and has offices in Israel and New York.

items.title: Saudi Telecom’s STC to launch full digibank services
items.summary:
- STC Bank, a subsidiary of Saudi Telecom Company, has received approval from the Saudi Central Bank (SAMA) to launch fully digital banking services in Saudi Arabia.
- The bank is transitioning from its previous identity as STC pay, focused on digital wallet services, to offering broader banking functions.
- Customers will be able to manage banking needs entirely online, including account opening, salary payments, fund transfers, and bill payments.

items.title: Indian health-food brand raises $3.4m series A
items.author: Varun Madan
items.summary:
- Salad Days, a health-focused food brand in India, raised ₹30 crore (approx. US$3.4 million) in a Series A funding round co-led by V3 Ventures and Client Associates Alternate Fund.
- This marks the company's first institutional funding after over a decade of operating profitably as a bootstrapped business.
- The funds will be used to expand Salad Days’ omnichannel presence, including opening new stores and enhancing technology.
- Plans include investing in talent acquisition, marketing, menu innovations, and exploring additional sales channels.
- Founded in 2014, Salad Days has 25 cloud kitchens and 12 outlets across Delhi-NCR, Bengaluru, and Mumbai.

items.title: US nominee claims DeepSeek used stolen US technology
items.summary:
- Howard Lutnick, President Trump’s commerce secretary nominee, testified on Jan. 29.
- Lutnick claimed that China's DeepSeek developed a powerful AI model using stolen US technology and advanced semiconductors.
- He emphasized the need for the US to establish global AI standards to maintain its leadership in AI development.

items.title: Ex-Binance CEO’s YZi Labs invests $16m in token platform
items.author: Changpeng 'CZ' Zhao
items.summary:
- Changpeng ‘CZ’ Zhao announces the first investment from his venture capital firm, YZi Labs.
- YZi Labs participated in a $16 million funding round for Sign, a token distribution platform.
- Sign specializes in token airdrop services and on-chain credential verification, addressing issues like token delivery discrepancies and multi-account participation.

items.title: DeepSeek boosts Zhejiang province’s AI innovation for growth
items.summary:
- DeepSeek is working to enhance AI innovation in Zhejiang province.
- The initiative aims to drive economic growth in the region.
- Several collaborations and partnerships are being formed to support AI development.

items.title: US may tighten Nvidia chip export rules: sources
items.summary:
- The Trump administration is considering stricter export controls on Nvidia’s H20 chips for China.
- New limitations are prompted by concerns over China’s growing AI capabilities.
- This follows reports of Chinese startup DeepSeek developing competitive AI with older Nvidia chips.
- The Biden administration had previously imposed export restrictions but allowed some shipments, including H20.
- Nvidia warned that further restrictions may harm US companies by accelerating China’s development of alternatives.
- Nvidia’s stock dropped nearly 7% amid investor concerns about tighter regulations and global competition.

items.title: Nvidia supplier manufacturer boosts forecast, sees AI demand
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Advantest Corp. raised its full-year profit forecast by nearly 40% due to increased AI spending.
- The company specializes in selling chip-testing equipment, which has strong demand due to AI investments from firms like Nvidia and AMD.
- CEO Douglas Lefever downplayed any notable impact from DeepSeek’s recent debut on Advantest’s outlook.
- Advantest anticipates continuous growth in demand for AI chips for applications like robotics and consumer devices.
- The forecasted operating profit for the year is now 226 billion yen (approximately US$1.5 billion), surpassing analyst expectations.
- The company believes that the influx of AI entrants will further boost demand.

items.title: Huawei pushes HarmonyOS Next for tech independence
items.summary:
- Huawei launched HarmonyOS Next in December 2024 with its Mate 70 smartphone.
- The OS is developed to provide a third mobile operating system independent from iOS and Android.
- HarmonyOS Next was created in response to US trade restrictions from 2019.
- It is currently in public testing on several Huawei devices in China, while international models still use EMUI.
- The OS supports popular Chinese apps but lacks many global apps such as Google Maps and Zoom.
- Huawei aims to expand its app ecosystem from 15,000 to 100,000 apps for improved compatibility.
- The initiative is part of China's broader goal for technological self-reliance, with plans to integrate the OS into wearables, automotive systems, and smart home devices.
